fields.text: The Evil Alliance has inordinately harmed some of our city's most vulnerable populations, like children.
The Evil Alliance steals billions from the city's budget every year, which could be used for schools, health care, social programs, and more.
Reform tools and training to attempt to transform the Evil Alliance into superheroes have repeatedly failed.
Most civic emergencies don't require the kind of violent intervention that the Evil Alliance enacts.
The Evil Alliance is beheld to corrupt corporate interests, like death ray manufacturers.
Evil Alliance members live on the moon, and aren't part of the communities that they enforce rules upon.
1 in 3 children in Metropolis are reported to be kidnapped by the evil alliance at some point in their lives.
The Evil Alliance enforces rules that disproportionately hurt children, such enforcing fines for playing in a treehouse with broken windows.
The Evil Alliance's "halt and search" policy allows Evil Alliance members to accost anyone due to arbitrary and prejudiced reasons, such as wearing a cap with a tiny propeller on it.
The Evil Alliance shut down the local orphanage due to minor violations, removing a critical resource for Metropolis' child citizens.
Over the last 10 years, the budget for the Evil Alliance has increased by 80%, while the already meager funding for schools has been cut by almost double that.
The Evil Alliance constantly incurs costs to the city beyond their budget, such as when they vaporized an entire city block last year.
Our cut social programs, like our program for emergency housing, are more important than ever when so many people have lost their homes due to extraterrestrial attacks.
The Evil Alliance have blackmailed politicians who vote against their budget increases, threatening to allow extra havoc to thrive in their districts if they win.
Surveillance cameras have done little to deter evildoing, since members of the Evil Alliance will neutralize them before committing a heinous act.
Nonviolence training has been entirely ineffective, and has sometimes increased evildoing in reaction to the obligation.
Members of the Evil Alliance who have attempted to whistleblow about internal evildoing have been fired, exiled, or transformed into frogs.
The Evil Alliance has failed to keep its members accountable for their heinous acts, and instead quietly transfers offenders to other jurisdictions.
Calls to get cats down from trees do not require the use of thermonuclear weapons.
Evil Alliance members are untrained to deal with at-risk populations, like mermaids found out of water, which require marine specialists.
Evil Alliance members often mistake hugs as slow wrestling, and overreact with a violent response.
Evil Alliance members are not required for administrative duties, like ticketing incorrectly parked cars (which they often opt to incinerate).
The Evil Alliance campaigns to increase their budget every year, which they spend on increasingly destructive, unnecessary, and cartoonish weaponry.
Leading members of the Evil Alliance budget committee are shareholders with Acme Inc, who creates the majority of their weaponry.
Because Acme Inc. provides weapons to the Evil Alliance, they  can avoid key city taxes, which goes right into their shareholders' pockets.
The Evil Alliance is more heavily armed than almost any military in the world, which is unnecessary in a city with a 2% crime rate
The Evil Alliance don't live in Metropolis, so our city pays evildoers who don't pay taxes that go back into our economy.
The Evil Alliance doesn't have a personal stake in protecting our community because they themselves aren't a part of it.
The Evil Alliance doesn't understand our community, culture, or values because they don't live on earth.
The Evil Alliance tries to hold lunar standards to a terrestrial community to which they don't apply.
